title: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org
description: Security Advisory for PHP packages hosted at packagist.org on GitHub

items.content_html:
CRLF injection vulnerability in Zend\Mail (Zend_Mail) in Zend Framework before 1.12.12, 2.x before 2.3.8, and 2.4.x before 2.4.1 allows remote attackers to inject arbitrary HTTP headers and conduct HTTP response splitting attacks via CRLF sequences in the header of an email.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-3154
  • http://framework.zend.com/security/advisory/ZF2015-04
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-5957-5crx-79jx
items.title: [zendframework/zendframework] Zenario CMS vulnerable to CRLF injection

items.content_html:

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in lib/javascript-static.js in Moodle through 2.5.9, 2.6.x before 2.6.9, 2.7.x before 2.7.6, and 2.8.x before 2.8.4 allow remote authenticated users to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via a (1) alt or (2) title attribute in an IMG element.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-2269
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=307383
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-49144
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/03/16/1
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/ead8b28f92da72fb836cf9183aaf6f11a7eb1a21
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-cp39-43xr-2wrp
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS Vulnerability

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Multiple open redirect vulnerabilities in Moodle through 2.5.9, 2.6.x before 2.6.11, 2.7.x before 2.7.8, and 2.8.x before 2.8.6 allow remote attackers to redirect users to arbitrary web sites and conduct phishing attacks via vectors involving an error page that links to a URL from an HTTP Referer header.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-3175
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=313682
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-49179
  • http://openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/05/18/1
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/b2687a055dc990ca86ddce178d5aee3fb1df644a
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/dd0607b7bbaff38cc62e4d00658c02da3fdbb4c8
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20201030042703/http://www.securitytracker.com/id/1032358
  • https://web.archive.org/web/20210122155902/http://www.securityfocus.com/bid/74720
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-h798-h7ff-93xv
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Arbitrary Redirect

items.content_html:
Multiple open redirect vulnerabilities in Moodle through 2.5.9, 2.6.x before 2.6.11, 2.7.x before 2.7.8, and 2.8.x before 2.8.6 allow remote attackers to redirect users to arbitrary web sites and conduct phishing attacks via vectors involving an error page that links to a URL from an HTTP Referer header.

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle Arbitrary Redirect

items.content_html:
Moodle through 2.6.11, 2.7.x before 2.7.11, 2.8.x before 2.8.9, and 2.9.x before 2.9.3 does not consider the moodle/badges:viewbadges capability, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive badge information via a request involving (1) badges/overview.php or (2) badges/view.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-5340
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=323235
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-51684
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/47d5c29202e299fdbe54229d3f6b0c381835eae3
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-mmvj-j7hq-rx85
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure

items.content_html:
Moodle through 2.6.11, 2.7.x before 2.7.11, 2.8.x before 2.8.9, and 2.9.x before 2.9.3 does not consider the moodle/badges:viewbadges capability, which allows remote authenticated users to obtain sensitive badge information via a request involving (1) badges/overview.php or (2) badges/view.php.

items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle sensitive information disclosure

items.content_html:
Moodle 2.9.x before 2.9.3 does not properly check the contact list before authorizing message transmission, which allows remote authenticated users to bypass intended access restrictions and conduct spam attacks via the messaging API.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-5331
  • https://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=323228
  • http://git.moodle.org/gw?p=moodle.git&a=search&h=HEAD&st=commit&s=MDL-50426
  • https://github.com/moodle/moodle/commit/cd0c9ac87d75b3d893d61df21e3ecfd12c065c1f
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-m7cc-6vhg-39wr
items.title: [moodle/moodle] Moodle improper access control

items.content_html:
A Command injection vulnerability in RaspAP 2.8.0 thru 2.8.7 allows unauthenticated attackers to execute arbitrary commands via the cfg_id parameter in /ajax/openvpn/activate_ovpncfg.php and /ajax/openvpn/del_ovpncfg.php.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2022-39986
  • https://github.com/RaspAP/raspap-webgui/blob/master/ajax/openvpn/activate_ovpncfg.php
  • https://medium.com/@ismael0x00/multiple-vulnerabilities-in-raspap-3c35e78809f2
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-7c28-wg7r-pg6f
items.title: [billz/raspap-webgui] RaspAP Command Injection vulnerability

items.content_html:
baserCMS before 3.0.8 allows remote authenticated users to modify arbitrary user settings via a crafted request.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-5640
  • http://basercms.net/security/JVN04855224
  • http://jvn.jp/en/jp/JVN04855224/index.html
  • http://jvndb.jvn.jp/jvndb/JVNDB-2015-000138
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v9gf-98vr-mgp2
items.title: [baserproject/basercms] baserCMS Access Control Bypass

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in SilverStripe CMS & Framework before 3.1.16 and 3.2.0 before 3.2.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) Locale or (2) FailedLoginCount parameter to admin/security/EditForm/field/Members/item/new/ItemEditForm.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-8606
  • https://cybersecurityworks.com/zerodays/cve-2015-8606-silverstripe.html
  • http://seclists.org/fulldisclosure/2015/Dec/55
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/12/17/1
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/12/17/11
  • http://www.openwall.com/lists/oss-security/2015/12/18/5
  • http://www.silverstripe.org/download/security-releases/ss-2015-026
  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-gvc8-xjfp-6569
items.title: [silverstripe/cms] Silverstripe CMS XSS Vulnerability

items.content_html:
Multiple cross-site scripting (XSS) vulnerabilities in SilverStripe CMS & Framework before 3.1.16 and 3.2.0 before 3.2.1 allow remote attackers to inject arbitrary web script or HTML via the (1) Locale or (2) FailedLoginCount parameter to admin/security/EditForm/field/Members/item/new/ItemEditForm.

References

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2015-8606
  • https://cybersecurityworks.com/zerodays/cve-2015-8606-silverstripe.html
